title: Texans playoff picture: Updated chances for Houston to make 2025 NFL postseason after Week 16 win over Raiders
description: The Texans are moving closer to a playoff return.
fullText:
Texans playoff picture: Updated chances for Houston to make 2025 NFL postseason after Week 16 win over Raiders originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Houston Texans don't always make it look pretty, but that's par for the course for a team driven by its defense.

After falling behind in the second half of Sunday's game against the Las Vegas Raiders, the Texans held on and won for the 10th time in their last 12 games after starting the season 0-3.

A seven-game win streak has the Texans dreaming of a deep playoff run, but have they clinched their spot in the postseason yet?

Here's what you need to know about the Texans' playoff chances and how they can punch their ticket.

How Travis Kelce's retirement decision is easy with no Patrick Mahomes

Panthers take control of NFC South with massive win over Buccaneers

Myles Garrett inches closer to NFL sack record with obscure half sack

Gardner Minshew suffers potential ACL tear in first Chiefs game without Patrick Mahomes

Quinshon Judkins out for season after gruesome leg injury vs. Bills

The Texans couldn't catch the Jacksonville Jaguars in the AFC South on Sunday with Jacksonville winning in Denver, but Houston's win ensures the race will remain a tight one entering the final two weeks of the season.

The Indianapolis Colts would be eliminated from AFC South contention with a loss to the San Francisco 49ers on Monday.

The Texans cannot clinch a playoff berth in Week 16, but the victory did bring them one major step closer to punching their ticket.

A Colts loss on Monday would make Houston's path to clinching in Week 17 much simpler, but the Texans are in control of their fate when it comes to getting into the playoffs.

Elsewhere, Sunday's results were not ideal for the Texans. Houston missed an opportunity to jump higher than the No. 7 seed because the Los Angeles Chargers and Buffalo Bills both won and the Jaguars maintained their lead in the AFC South.

Watch DK Metcalf throw punch at Lions fan on sidelines

Kenneth Gainwell makes circus catch for potential coach of the year

The Texans have a tough test against the Chargers in Week 17, going out to the West Coast to play a critical Saturday game against a likely playoff team.

Houston closes its season against the Colts, though it's unclear whether Indianapolis will still be in playoff contention by Week 18.

title: Patriots game day roster: NFL Week 16 vs. Ravens
description: A look at the Patriots‚Äô game day roster for their Week 16 game on Sunday night.
fullText:
With Robert Spillane sidelined throughout the game, the New England Patriots‚Äô linebacker group had a disappointing outing last week versus the Buffalo Bills. The challenge will not be any easier for the position on Sunday night against the Baltimore Ravens.

Not only will Spillane miss a second straight game because of an ankle injury, the Ravens feature one of the best run games in the NFL. Led by the two-headed monster of quarterback Lamar Jackson and running back Derrick Henry, they are entering Sunday as the league leaders in yards per carry (5.2).

With Spillane out, that means the task on stopping this potent an attack will fall on replacement starting duo Jack Gibbens and Christian Elliss. As head coach Mike Vrabel pointed out on Friday, however, they will not be the only one in the spotlight.

‚ÄúEverybody that goes to the game is going to play and have a role, and we ask everybody to prepare as starters,‚Äù Vrabel explained. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs something that‚Äôs important. And so, Gibby will start in there, and then different guys will play, packages and everything else.‚Äù

New England‚Äôs full game day roster against the Ravens looks as follows:

Quarterback (2):¬†Drake Maye (10), Joshua Dobbs (11)

Running back (4):¬†Rhamondre Stevenson (38), TreVeyon Henderson (32), D‚ÄôErnest Johnson (34), Jack Westover (37 | FB/TE)

Wide receiver (5):¬†Kayshon Boutte (9), Stefon Diggs (8), Mack Hollins (13), DeMario Douglas (3), Kyle Williams (18 | KR)

Tight end (2):¬†Hunter Henry (85), Austin Hooper (81)

Offensive tackle (3):¬†Vederian Lowe (59 | LT), Morgan Moses (76 | RT), Thayer Munford Jr. (74)

Interior offensive line (5):¬†Jared Wilson (58 | LG), Garrett Bradbury (65 | C), Mike Onwenu (71 | RG), Ben Brown (77), Caedan Wallace (70)

Interior defensive line (5):¬†Christian Barmore (90), Khyiris Tonga (95 | FB), Cory Durden (94), Eric Gregory (55), Joshua Farmer (92)

Defensive edge (5):¬†Harold Landry III (2), K‚ÄôLavon Chaisson (44), Elijah Ponder (91), Anfernee Jennings (33), Bradyn Swinson (43)

Linebacker (5):¬†Jack Gibbens (51), Christian Elliss (53), Jahlani Tavai (48), Marte Mapu (15), Chad Muma (49)

Cornerback (5):¬†Christian Gonzalez (0), Carlton Davis III (7), Marcus Jones (25 | PR), Charles Woods (22), Miles Battle (35)

Safety (4):¬†Jaylinn Hawkins (21), Craig Woodson (31), Dell Pettus (24), Brenden Schooler (41)

Specialists (3):¬†Andy Borregales (36 | K), Bryce Baringer (17 | P/H), Julian Ashby (47 | LS)

The Patriots‚Äô front seven is seeing some changes compared to last week. Not only is Chad Muma active as extra depth at linebacker and on special teams just five days after getting claimed off waivers from the Indianapolis Colts, two recent inactives are also up this week: Eric Gregory will provide additional depth at defensive tackle, while Bradyn Swinson should help on the edge.

Swinson‚Äôs presence on the game day roster comes in light of starter Harold Landry being questionable with a knee injury. The fifth-round rookie has appeared in one game so far, playing 10 snaps in the kicking game but none on defense.

Inactives (5): QB3 Tommy DeVito (16), WR Efton Chism III (86), TE C.J. Dippre (82), OT Marcus Bryant (52), LB Robert Spillane (14)

Practice squad (16):¬†RB Jashaun Corbin (30), WR John Jiles (83), WR Jeremiah Webb (29), OL Sebastian Gutierrez (72), OL Andrew Rupcich (67), OL Brenden Jaimes (61), OL Mehki Butler (63), DT Jeremiah Pharms Jr. (98), DT Leonard Taylor III (93), DT Fabien Lovett Sr. (96), LB Amari Gainer (45), LB Otis Reese (54), CB Brandon Crossley (46), CB Kobee Minor (19), S Richie Grant (39), S John Saunders Jr. (23)

Practice squad/exempt (1):¬†TE Thomas Odukoya (88 | IPPP)

Practice squad/injured (2):¬†RB Craig Reynolds, LB Darius Harris

Reserve/injured (11):¬†FB Brock Lampe, OT Yasir Durant, CB Marcellas Dial Jr., DT Jaquelin Roy, RB Lan Larison, RB Deneric Prince, DT Isaiah Iton, RB Antonio Gibson, DT Milton Williams, CB Alex Austin, OT Will Campbell, RB Terrell Jennings

Reserve/retired (1):¬†OL Wes Schweitzer

With no players elevated from the practice squad, a total of five players were ruled out on Sunday. The list includes no surprises, with Spillane, who was deemed inactive ahead of the weekend already, as the only noteworthy absence.

The Patriots‚Äô game against the Ravens will kick off at 8:20 p.m. ET at M&T Bank Stadium in Baltimore.

title: Trevor Lawrence, Jaguars steamroll Denver defense to snap 11-game Broncos win streak, put No. 1 seed in AFC up for grabs
description: If you weren't counting the Jaguars among Super Bowl contenders before, it's time to reconsider that stance.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos rolled into Week 16 against the Jacksonville Jaguars riding an 11-game win streak with visions of clinching the No. 1 seed in the AFC playoffs.

The Jaguars had other ideas. Sparked by another big game from quarterback Trevor Lawrence, the Jaguars steamrolled the vaunted Broncos' defense in Denver to secure a 34-20 win.

With the win, the Jaguars improve to 11-4 while turning the race for the No. 1 seed in the AFC into a five-team contest. The Broncos drop to 12-3, while the 11-4 Chargers, 11-4 Bills and 11-3 Patriots (ahead of Sunday night's game against the Ravens) all remain in the race for the first-round bye in the AFC playoff bracket.

Lawrence led the way while completing 23 of 36 passes for for 279 yards with 3 touchdowns and no interceptions. He added 20 yards and a fourth touchdown on the ground.

This, a week after Lawrence led a 48-20 romp over the Jets with 330 passing yards, 5 touchdowns and no turnovers. But that was against the Jets.

Sunday was against a Super Bowl-contending Broncos team with one of the best defenses in football. And if you weren't counting the Jaguars among Super Bowl contenders before, it's time to reconsider that stance.

The early portion of Sunday's contest was a back-and-forth affair that saw the Broncos tie the game at 17-17 early in the third quarter. But the tenor of the game took a dramatic shift on Jacksonville's first possession of the second half.

Sparked by a pair of big penalties, the Jaguars drove 75 yards for a touchdown. A roughing the passing penalty for bodyweight on a hit of Lawrence on first down moved the Jaguars across midfield and riled up the raucous Denver crowd.

Then in the red zone on second down, the Broncos got flagged for pass interference in the end zone when Jahdae Barron grabbed Parker Washington's arm while the ball was in the air. This brought the home crowd into a frenzy.

Lawrence responded by running untouched into the end zone for 24-17 lead Jaguars lead.

Back and forth we goooo@trevorlawrence | #JAXvsDEN on FOXpic.twitter.com/ySt0CgOLMW

‚Äî Jacksonville Jaguars (@Jaguars) December 21, 2025

The Broncos had multiple chances to answer, but there was no Bo Nix magic in the second half this time.

Denver punted after four plays on its ensuing possession. Following another Jaguars touchdown for a 31-17 lead, a botched handoff from Nix to Jaleel McLaughlin resulted in Denver's first turnover of the game. The Jaguars converted that fumble into a field goal for a 34-17 lead.

Then with 8:08 remaining, Nix forced a sideline pass to Pat Bryant in tight coverage. Jarrian Jones was there for the interception to all but ice the Jacksonville win.

Bo Nix is intercepted by Jarrian Jones üëÄ

üì∫ FOX pic.twitter.com/4pNMf0lkHU

‚Äî FOX Sports: NFL (@NFLonFOX) December 21, 2025

For the day, Nix completed 28 of 47 passes for 352 yards with 1 touchdown and 1 interception. He was credited with a lost fumble on the botched handoff in the third quarter. And the Jaguars finished the game with a 2-0 advantage in takeaways. Those turnovers ultimately tanked any hope of a Broncos comeback.

Even with the loss, the Broncos maintain control of that No. 1 seed. Their 12-3 record remains alone atop the AFC. And they hold the tiebreaker over the Patriots if the Patriots win Sunday night.

But with two weeks remaining in the season, the race for that No. 1 seed is anything but settled. And the Chargers could still win the AFC West. The Broncos and Chargers will face off in Week 18, when the division title could be at stake.

title: Broncos WR Pat Bryant carted off field vs. Jaguars
description: Prayers up for Broncos WR Pat Bryant, who was carted off the field on Sunday.
fullText:
Denver Broncos wide receiver Pat Bryant was carted off the field after taking a hard hit from Jacksonville Jaguars cornerback Montaric Brown on one of the final plays of Sunday's game at Empower Field at Mile High.

Brown was initially penalized for the hit, but officials picked up the flag after the cornerback was deemed to have hit Bryant in the chest, not in the head. Players for both teams gathered around Bryant while he was on the ground. Denver quarterback Bo Nix slammed his helmet on the ground after the play.

Bryant was placed on a backboard and carted to the locker room with 31 seconds remaining. Nix then threw a short pass to running back Tyler Badie, who went down after two yards, sealing a 34-20 loss for the Broncos.

Bryant had five catches for 42 yards before suffering the injury. The third-round pick out of Illinois had totaled 22 receptions for 305 yards and one score going into the game.

This article originally appeared on Broncos Wire: NFL news: Broncos WR Pat Bryant carted off field vs. Jaguars

title: Sergio Vega, Oklahoma State wrestling top Nebraska for second time
description: No. 5-ranked Oklahoma State topped No. 6-ranked Nebraska 22-12 in a wrestling dual Sunday afternoon at the Devaney Center in Lincoln, Nebraska.
fullText:
No. 5-ranked Oklahoma State topped No. 6-ranked Nebraska 22-12 in a wrestling dual Sunday afternoon at the Devaney Center in Lincoln, Nebraska, taking six of the 10 bouts.

OSU (8-1) has topped Nebraska (6-3) twice this season, including the third-place match at the National Duals Invitational in Tulsa.

The Cowboys also now have five ranked wins this season, including three over top-10 teams.

On Sunday, true freshman Sergio Vega picked up huge bonus points with a first-period pin of three-time All-American Brock Hardy in the 141-pound match. It was the first time Hardy had been pinned in his career. Vega now has four top-10 wins in just eight collegiate bouts.

More: Konner Doucet vs AJ Ferrari tops key matchups in Oklahoma State-Nebraska wrestling dual

OSU's Troy Spratley opened the match with major decision.

The Cowboys clinched the victory in the 197-pound match. Holding a 16-12 lead, Cody Merrill rode out Camden McDanel in the third for a 2-1 win. It was Merrill's second win over McDanel.

Former Cowboy AJ Ferrari, now a heavyweight with the Huskers, did not wrestle for a third straight dual.

OSU is off until Jan. 3, when it travels to Chattanooga, Tennessee, for the Southern Scuffle. The Pokes' next dual is a home Bedlam bout with OU on Jan. 11.

This article originally appeared on Oklahoman: Sergio Vega, Oklahoma State wrestling top Nebraska in top-10 dual

title: Knights in the NBA: Two Budding Stars
description: Bailey, Harper starting to make their mark in the NBA.
fullText:
We are three months into the NBA season, and the two former superstars for Rutgers men‚Äôs basketball are proving why they were drafted high and are showing potential to dominate the league for years to come.

Ace Bailey, despite a slower start to the season, is playing his best basketball as of late. Bailey started the year by averaging 4.4 points per game in October. However, in the two months since then, Bailey has averaged 12.1 points in November and 11.5 points in December. He has already had three 20-point games and has all but three games in double-digit points in December. He has recorded several highlight-worthy shots, including the one below.

Bailey still has a lot of development to do to reach his maximum potential in the NBA. If his time so far is any indication, he is on an upward trajectory to reach that level. He was viewed as an all-around project when he was drafted by the Jazz. In particular, his field goal shooting percentage, defense, and rebounding still need a lot of work. Regardless, he has looked better and better with each passing game.

HERE COMES ACE BAILEY ‚ÄºÔ∏è

THE ROOK JUST ROCKED THE RIM IN UTAH.

Tap to watch: https://t.co/nnbneYnnKu pic.twitter.com/2bnTNCCWqB

Arguably, the more NBA-ready of the two when they declared for the draft, Dylan Harper has already demonstrated an ability to take over games, despite playing in the NBA for less than three whole months. Against Washington earlier in the month, Harper recorded 24 points and five rebounds in San Antonio‚Äôs dominating 119-94 win over the Wizards. This is not the first time this season he has recorded a similar stat line, as he has recorded games with 20 or more points and six or more rebounds two other times.

Harper is averaging 48.2 percent on field goals, which is just above the average for NBA players, which has been 46.9 percent this season. However, this three-point percentage needs some work, as he is averaging 30.2 percent per game this season when the league average for three-point percentage per game is 35.8 percent.

Dylan Harper 24 Points, 5 Rebs, 3 Assists full highlight vs Wizards I 25-26 NBA Season pic.twitter.com/XfqF8sWvYR

‚Äî Hoops Showtime (@HoopsShowtime12) December 19, 2025

Both have shown their ability to score so far in this league. Now they need to prove that they can be contributors in the other statistics. Those will likely start to click as they get more experience on an NBA court.

Ron Harper Jr. has spent most of his time this season on the Boston Celtics G League squad, the Maine Celtics. However, he has been called up to the main roster a few times, where he was largely used as a rotational piece due to injuries. Harper has seen action in four NBA games this season, seeing 20 minutes on the floor across all four. He has 8 points so far this season, with six of them coming in the Celtics game against the Memphis Grizzlies. He has three rebounds on the year as well, all of which came against Houston.

title: Blue Jays CEO Shares Bold Take On Red Sox‚Äôs Future
description: Toronto Blue Jays President and CEO Mark Shapiro believes the Boston Red Sox could be the team to beat. The Red Sox made the playoffs last season and have been active this offseason, adding the likes of Sonny Gray and Johan Oviedo to round out their pitching staff. Yet, Boston is still led by a [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Toronto Blue Jays President and CEO Mark Shapiro believes the Boston Red Sox could be the team to beat.

The Red Sox made the playoffs last season and have been active this offseason, adding the likes of Sonny Gray and Johan Oviedo to round out their pitching staff.

Yet, Boston is still led by a young core that features the likes of Roman Anthony, Marcelo Mayer, and Cedanne Rafaela, while Garrett Crochet is the team‚Äôs ace. With that, Shapiro believes no team is better set up for the next five years than the Red Sox.

‚ÄúBoston is probably positioned as well as any team in all of Major League Baseball,‚Äù Shapiro said on MLB Network Radio on Sunday. ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if there is a team that is positioned for the next five years better than the Boston Red Sox with young talent and flexibility.‚Äù

It‚Äôs a bold take from the Blue Jays CEO, as the Red Sox are a division rival of Toronto, but Shapiro clearly likes what he sees from Boston.

With Shapiro expecting the Red Sox to be better, he knows the AL East will be a tough division to win this year.

‚ÄúWe already knew Baltimore was going to be better than they were last year,‚Äù Shapiro added. ‚ÄúAll you have to do is look at them in the second half. They clearly have gotten better with Taylor Ward, with Shane Baz, and others.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôve had a good offseason, and I don‚Äôt think they are done. The Yankees are clearly, you know, they are not done. Tampa is going to be better; they are never bad, they are going to be better.‚Äù

Although Shapiro believes everyone in the AL East will be better, his comments about the Red Sox stand out.

Red Sox Reportedly Swing Huge Trade For Three-Time All-Star

title: Instant reaction: Broncos‚Äô defense fizzles out as Jaguars route Denver 34-20
description: The Denver Broncos had their 11-game winning streak come to an end with their 34-20 loss to the Jacksonville Jaguars.
fullText:
The Denver Broncos hosted the roaring Jacksonville Jaguars in their Week 16 matchup. A gridiron battle of two division leaders, this one was expected to be a close and hard-fought matchup. It turned out to be the opposite, with the Jaguars throttling the Broncos 34-20 and ending their 11-game winning streak. Here are some instant reactions and key takeaways from today‚Äôs game.

Penalties, drops, and miscues plague Broncos‚Äô offensive effort

Last week against the Green Bay Packers, Bo Nix and the offense had one of their most complete games of the season. In order to defeat the Jaguars, they needed to replicate some of that success. Sadly, that was far from the case with only several good drives through sixty minutes of play.

After struggling in the first quarter, they were able muster a quality scoring drive early on in the second quarter. A 15-yard fade to Courtland Sutton tied the game up. A few drives later, Wil Lutz was able to connect on a 54-yard field goal to give the Broncos a 10-7 lead‚Äîbut that was short-lived with Denver being down 17-10 at halftime.

Denver‚Äôs first drive of the second half couldn‚Äôt have gone any better. Rookie running back RJ Harvey broke a few tackles and dove for the pylon to cap off a 38-yard touchdown scamper that tied the game up at 17. It was an absolutely marvelous play by the second-round pick. After that? There wasn‚Äôt much to write home about.

Three-and-outs and stalled drives were a theme for the Broncos thereafter. A failed handoff exchange between Nix and Jaleel McLaughlin late in the third quarter was the straw that broke the camel‚Äôs back with Denver already down 31-17. In the fourth quarter down 34-20, Nix threw an interception on fourth down that officially ended any hopes of a miracle comeback.

Penalties, drops, turnovers, and miscues all played a culprit in the Broncos‚Äô regression on offense against the Jaguars. Ther only bright spot on offense was Harvey‚Äôs performance. It was in a losing effort, but over 120 all-purpose yards and a touchdown is praiseworthy. The team will continue to need him to play at a high level in the final weeks of the season to help secure the division title and top seed in the AFC.

Jarrian Jones picks off Nix!

JAXvsDEN on FOX/FOX Onehttps://t.co/HkKw7uXnxV pic.twitter.com/F9MjGz2RRZ

Defense fails to show up in worst performance of the season

The Jaguars entered today‚Äôs contest averaging well over 30 points a game since their bye week. Both Trevor Lawrence and Travis Etienne were on hot streaks. It was a big task for the Broncos to slow them down. Unfortunately, they struggled all game long and had their worst performance of the year. It was ugly throughout four quarters.

One area of concern I had was how safety P.J. Locke would hold up in coverage. He surrendered a touchdown reception to tight end Brenton Strange in the second quarter‚Äîaided by a clear push off by Strange. However, he was also targeted often on the Jaguars‚Äô scoring drive right before halftime and also in the second half. It‚Äôs clear that Brandon Jones‚Äô presence in the backend of Denver‚Äôs secondary was sorely missed.

On top of that, Lawrence was able to light up the Broncos‚Äô red zone defense. Entering today‚Äôs game, Denver‚Äôs red zone defense was best in the NFL in ‚Äò25 and a huge strength. Today? They gave up four touchdowns in Jacksonville‚Äôs first four trips inside the 20. That‚Äôs certainly not a recipe for success. It was Murphy‚Äôs Law for the Broncos on defense this afternoon.

Missed tackles, missed coverage assignments, and penalties hampered Denver‚Äôs ability to thwart Jacksonville‚Äôs offensive endeavors. The Jaguars were routinely able to create yards after the catch and blow past Broncos defenders. It‚Äôs been a long time since we have seen them play this poorly. But perhaps a wakeup call was eventually in order. It‚Äôs really not worth mentioning ‚Äòelite‚Äô and this defense in the same sentence any longer.

After multiple weeks of showing concerning weaknesses, all of the Broncos‚Äô biggest flaws were exposed today. With only two games remaining before the playoffs, the team doesn‚Äôt have long to correct them. If they can‚Äôt, their hopes of a strong postseason push may be in jeopardy. Defensive Coordinator Vance Joseph and his players have their work cut out for them.

This Bronco Defense is all kinds of out of sorts. 

Busting coverages, not setting edges, no QB player on obvious Zone Read situations. 

Trevor Lawrence & Liam Cohen continue to punch the bruise. 

The Brandon Jones loss looms larger than I would have expected.

‚Äî Coach Mike Sanford (@Coach_Sanford2) December 21, 2025

Denver can‚Äôt let this loss linger. Recalibrate and beat the Chiefs on Christmas.

All good things come to an end. It‚Äôs been an awesome season for the Broncos, but their eleven-game winning streak is now over. Getting pummeled at home by the Jaguars wasn‚Äôt on the radar for me. I thought the Broncos would win in a close game.

A huge credit to Jacksonville for being the better team today. They executed a great gameplan on both sides of the ball. They also delivered Denver their first loss at home since October of last season. That‚Äôs pretty wild when you think about it.

That being said, the Broncos can‚Äôt afford to dwell on this loss and let it linger. They need to shift gears quickly and be prepared to defeat the Kansas City Chiefs at Arrowhead Stadium on Christmas. There usually isn‚Äôt a good way to spin a loss, but this sort of adversity might be important for the Broncos to experience before the postseason hits.

It can serve as a bit of a reality check for them. Moreover, it‚Äôs certainly a woeful performance where there will be ample tape to show what they need to correct and improve upon. The next two games are against division rivals. They are must-win games for Denver to win the AFC West and find a way to edge out the competition for that coveted first-round bye and homefield advantage that comes with the #1 seed.

Will the Broncos be able to show some tenacity and resiliency over the next two weeks? I sure hope so. So much is at stake. Let‚Äôs hope they can finish off the season strong with back-to-back wins. Although it isn‚Äôt going to be easy, especially with Pat Bryant and Dre Greenlaw being injured late in today‚Äôs game.

Probably a good time to note that the Broncos can lose today and still get the No. 1 seed with 2 wins.

And also that every time they've won the SB they've had back-to-back December losses. (Not saying you want that here, because that means losing to a KC team w/ its No. 3 QB)

‚Äî Andrew Mason (@MaseDenver) December 21, 2025

title: Texans survive with 23-21 win over Raiders
description: The Texans were expected to beat the Raiders easily.
fullText:
The Texans were expected to beat the Raiders easily. Houston did win, but it wasn't easy.

In a surprisingly competitive game, the Raiders took a second-half lead and the Texans needed to come back and then hold on in the fourth quarter to survive with a 23-21 win.

Texans quarterback CJ Stroud completed 23 of 35 passes for 187 yards, with a touchdown and no interceptions. Raiders quarterback Geno Smith completed 16 of 23 passes for 201 yards, with two touchdowns and one interception.

The star of the game for the Raiders was rookie running back Ashton Jeanty, who had 24 carries for 128 yards and a touchdown, and added a 60-yard receiving touchdown. In an up-and-down rookie season, Jeanty showed everything the Raiders wanted to see from him today.

But it wasn't enough, and the Texans won to improve to 10-5 and stay in contention for both the AFC South and a wild card berth. The loss drops the Raiders to 2-13 and keeps them in contention for the first overall pick in the 2026 NFL draft.

title: Brutal QB luck continues for Chiefs with Gardner Minshew injury
description: Things went from bad to worse for the Kansas City Chiefs at the quarterback position on Sunday against the Tennessee Titans.
fullText:
Things went from bad to worse for the Kansas City Chiefs at the quarterback position on Sunday against the Tennessee Titans.

The Chiefs had already taken a major blow as they lost starting quarterback and multi-time Super Bowl Champion Patrick Mahomes last week to a torn ACL in a loss to the Chargers that eliminated the team from playoff contention for the first time in over a decade. But just when Chiefs fans thought the tough times couldn't get much tougher, that is exactly what happened as backup quarterback Gardner Minshew left the game against the Titans due to injury.

The real kicker? Early reports indicate that Minshew also tore his ACL, becoming the second quarterback for the Chiefs to do so in two weeks ‚Äì and forcing Kansas City into a position where they will have to finish their last two games without their top two quarterbacks.

Chiefs are concerned that QB Gardner Minshew tore his ACL, as @mattderrick also reported. There will be additional tests but Minshew could be the second Chiefs‚Äô quarterback in two games to tear his ACL. pic.twitter.com/vDVoxOTGKb

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) December 21, 2025

To add insult to (literal) injury, the Chiefs would end up losing the game to the Titans 26-9, handing Tennessee just their third win of the season in the process. Kansas City dropped to 6-9 overall with the loss, further worsening an already disappointing season for the Chiefs which still features an upcoming game with the AFC West leader and potential top AFC playoff seed the Denver Broncos.

The Chiefs will now turn to third-string quarterback Chris Oladokun, who starred in college at South Florida, Samford, and South Dakota State before being drafted in the seventh round of the 2022 NFL Draft by the Steelers before eventually landing in Kansas City.

He entered Sunday's loss to the Chiefs following the injury to Minshew, and completed his first career pass on a touchdown to Travis Kelce. He would finish the game 11-of-16 with 111 passing yards and two carries for seven yards, but it was not enough to help the Chiefs to victory.

This article originally appeared on Touchdown Wire: Brutal QB luck continues for Chiefs with Gardner Minshew injury

title: Pat Bryant injury update: Latest news on Broncos WR's status after Week 16 game
description: Denver Broncos wide receiver Pat Bryant is dealing with an injury in the fourth quarter of the Week 16 game against the Jacksonville Jaguars.
fullText:
Pat Bryant injury update: Latest news on Broncos WR's status after Week 16 game originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Denver Broncos have an injury concern with wide receiver Pat Bryant late in the Week 16 game against the Jacksonville Jaguars.

Bryant suffered his injury in the final minute of the contest when he took a very hard hit over the middle of the field while trying to make a catch.

Follow our tracker below for the latest updates on Bryant's status.

Bryant has stayed down on the field after the play in what is a scary scene. Players from both teams are showing clear concern for his well-being.

title: Baker Mayfield brutally honest over Bucs' offensive failure vs. Panthers
description: Baker didn't leave any doubt where his frustrations lie.
fullText:
Baker Mayfield brutally honest over Bucs' offensive failure vs. Panthers originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Tampa Bay Buccaneers' freefall in the second half of the season has continued, with a 23-20 loss to the Carolina Panthers.

The loss now sees the Bucs lose six of their last seven games and gives the Panthers the lead in the NFC South race.

It was once again¬†a game in which the Buccaneers' self-inflicted wounds plagued them, with a miscommunication on the final play between Baker Mayfield and Mike Evans resulting in a game-sealing interception.

And for Baker, speaking post-game, he left it pretty clear what he thought about the offensive performance.

"Got to win out to win the division, get in the playoffs," Mayfield said. "It's as clear as it can be. Wish we would have taken care of business today, but situation doesn't change. It sucks. Too many penalties, kept shooting ourselves in the foot, and got to finish with seven in the red zone instead of three. Same story, different day."

More:Why Buccaneers fans might not like Todd Bowles' message after Panthers loss

Yes, the Buccaneers can still win the division if they win their remaining two games, but currently on a run of form that has seen them lose six of their last seven, are we even sure they can beat the Miami Dolphins on the road next week?

Then the Panthers are at home to close out the season.

But in order to win their final two, the self-inflicted wounds have to stop.

Because losing to a better team is one thing, but losing when you hand them the bat to hit you over the head with, that's tough to deal with.

And right now, the Buccaneers have some soul-searching to do because after starting the year 5-1, they have fallen off a cliff, and making the playoffs now looks like a tough assignment.

title: 45-yard TDs were the Pittsburgh Steelers' specialty in Week 16 vs. Lions
description: They only knew one way to score.
fullText:
45-yard TDs were the Pittsburgh Steelers' specialty in Week 16 vs. Lions originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Pittsburgh Steelers only knew one way to score on Sunday.

If they were 45 yards out, they were going to end up in the end zone. Otherwise, no touchdowns.

This is how that broke down on Sunday against the Lions in Week 16: The Steelers scored three TDs, and all three were from exactly 45 yards out.

Kenneth Gainwell had the first one. It was on a wild catch from Aaron Rodgers in which Gainwell was interfered with, fell, caught the ball on his backside, got up and sprinted away and into the end zone.

Then it was the same guy, twice: Jaylen Warren.

MORE:¬†Taysom Hill makes the kind of NFL history only he can make

He ran for one 45-yard touchdown to go up 22-10.

Then he ran for another one to go up 29-17.

Both epic Warren runs came in the fourth quarter.

It's exactly what the Steelers ordered. They entered the day with a one-game lead in the AFC North on the Baltimore Ravens, but going up against the formidable Lions in Detroit wasn't a given.

Pittsburgh doesn't get a lot of big plays. Their scoring drives are often long and plodding and tight end-heavy.

On this evening, though, the Steelers dialed up the big plays thrice, each from exactly 45 yards out. That was the sweet spot for the Steelers.

title: Panthers rookie Lathan Ransom goes from goat to hero in one week after game-clinching interception
description: Carolina Panthers rookie safety Lathan Ransom has experienced the dramatic highs and lows of playing in the NFL in his first season.  One week after a crucial penalty that led to a costly loss to the New Orleans Saints, Ransom redeemed himself on Sunday by intercepting Baker Mayfield with 42 seconds left to seal the Panthers' 23-20 win over the Buccaneers ‚Äî allowing Carolina to vault into sole possession of first place in the NFC South.  Ransom couldn't have felt much worse last week on the flight home from New Orleans after he was flagged for hitting sliding Saints quarterback Tyler Shough with 9 seconds left on a bang-bang play.
fullText:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) ‚Äî Carolina Panthers rookie safety Lathan Ransom has experienced the dramatic highs and lows of playing in the NFL in his first season.

One week after a crucial penalty that led to a costly loss to the New Orleans Saints, Ransom redeemed himself on Sunday by intercepting Baker Mayfield with 42 seconds left to seal the Panthers' 23-20 win over the Buccaneers ‚Äî allowing Carolina to vault into sole possession of first place in the NFC South.

‚ÄúI faced a lot of adversity, and I heard noise from everybody last week,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚Äú... (But) that‚Äôs how you shake back.‚Äù

Ransom couldn't have felt much worse last week on the flight home from New Orleans after he was flagged for hitting sliding Saints quarterback Tyler Shough with 9 seconds left on a bang-bang play. Officials flagged Ransom for unnecessary roughness, and the 15-yard penalty turned a difficult 61-yard field goal attempt into a far more makable one from 46 yards.

Charlie Smyth put it through the uprights to complete the Saints' 20-17 come-from-behind win.

Had the Panthers defeated the Saints, they would have only needed to beat the Bucs on Sunday to clinch the NFC South and end a seven-year playoff drought. Instead, the loss left the Panthers on the outside of the playoff bubble.

Ransom said he was hard on himself.

But the fourth-draft pick from Ohio State decided early last week that instead of dwelling on the mistake he'd use it as motivation.

‚ÄúI understand that the game is not won or lost by one play, but people behind their phone are going to have their own opinions,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚ÄúI just heard all the noise ‚Äî listened to it and used it as fuel for this game.‚Äù

Ransom leaned on the support last week of veteran defensive leaders such as Jaycee Horn, Derrick Brown and Mike Jackson, who shares the locker next to him.

Jackson and others advised to look ahead, not back and keeping playing at full speed.

‚ÄúHe responded like a grown man should," Jackson said. ‚ÄúAt the end of day, everyone was talking trash to him, like he shouldn't be in the game and this and that. And today he responded like he should be. I'll just say I'm proud of him. Because at the end of the day it's grown man football and he showed that.‚Äù

Panthers coach Dave Canales greeted Ransom on the sideline with a huge hug after interception, and smiled as he spoke about the rookie after the game.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a great story,‚Äù Canales said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs fantastic and it‚Äôs just about belief and having confidence in our guys to be able to be studs about the things we need to work on and be studs about the different decisions that come up. I love that for Lathan ‚Äî for him to be able to make the winning play, the biggest play of the game for us.‚Äù

The Panthers will need more big plays from Ransom and other young players if they hope to dethrone the Buccaneers, who have won the last four NFC South titles.

Carolina can clinch the division with a win next week against Seattle and a Tampa Bay loss to Miami. But if the Bucs win, it will come down to a rematch in Week 18 for the division title.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve learned a bunch throughout the season, especially from that first game,‚Äù Ransom said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to learn. It‚Äôs a learning process. You‚Äôre playing with the best of the best. I learn more and more every game and I try to take those teachings into the next game.‚Äù

AP NFL: https://apnews.com/hub/nfl

title: NFL playoff picture: What Texans‚Äô win over Raiders means for AFC standings in Week 16
description: The Texans face the Raiders in Houston on Sunday. We break down what the game means for the NFL playoff picture in Week 16.
fullText:
Game result: The Texans beat the Raiders, 23-21, in Week 16. Houston improves to 10-5 on the year and stays at the No. 7 seed in the AFC Playoff picture. Houston remains a game behind the Jacksonville Jaguars in the AFC South, who moved to 11-4 with their win over the Denver Broncos on Week 16.

The Houston Texans are closing in on a playoff berth, but it will be at least another week before they will have a clinching scenario. The Texans host the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 16 and this is a game they absolutely cannot lose.

The Texans are 9-5 and have won six straight in a streak that has included wins over the Jaguars, Bills, Colts, and Chiefs. They beat the Cardinals 40-20 last week. The Texans face a Raiders squad that is 2-12 and has lost eight straight games. Last week, the Raiders were thumped by the Eagles 31-0 in Philly.

Houston is a 14.5-point favorite, which is the biggest spread of Week 16.

The Texans are in second place in the division sitting one game back of the Jaguars. Houston and Jacksonville split their season series and the Texans have a half game lead for the divisional tiebreaker (4-1 vs. 3-1). The Jaguars are traveling to face the Broncos this weekend, so if they lose that but win their two remaining games, the tiebreaker would go to record in common games.

Meanwhile, the Colts sit a game back of the Texans and still has one game left with them. Houston won the first game in Week 13. The Colts need to see the Texans lose in Week 16 or 17 to create a situation in which the Colts can finish ahead of them.

The Texans are in seventh place and hold the final wild card spot ahead of the 8-6 Colts and 7-7 Ravens. If the Texans win and the Colts lose, Houston would have a wild card clinching scenario in Week 17 when they travel to face the Chargers. The Texans enter Week 16 with a 98% chance of making the playoffs at The Athletic‚Äôs playoff simulator. Houston has a 58% chance of claiming a wild card berth and a 40% chance of winning the division.

The Raiders are a common opponent for the Texans and Jaguars. There is a very real chance the Texans and Jaguars finish tied and it common opponents. They are also a common opponent with the Chargers, but Houston and LA will have a head-to-head tiebreaker sorted out when they meet in Week 17.

title: Bijan Robinson leads Falcons to 2nd straight win, 26-19 over woeful Cardinals
description: Bijan Robinson gained 171 yards from scrimmage and had a touchdown catch, Kirk Cousins threw two TD passes and ran for a score, and the Atlanta Falcons held on to beat the Arizona Cardinals 26-19 on Sunday.  The Falcons (6-9) won for the second straight week, with both coming on the road.  Arizona's defense made a fourth-down stop at its own 40-yard line with 2:05 left, setting up a chance to tie the game or take the lead, but Atlanta's C.J. Henderson made a diving interception of Jacoby Brissett's pass with 1:30 remaining to seal it.
fullText:
GLENDALE, Ariz. (AP) ‚Äî Bijan Robinson gained 171 yards from scrimmage and had a touchdown catch, Kirk Cousins threw two TD passes and ran for a score, and the Atlanta Falcons held on to beat the Arizona Cardinals 26-19 on Sunday.

The Falcons (6-9) won for the second straight week, with both coming on the road.

Arizona's defense made a fourth-down stop at its own 40-yard line with 2:05 left, setting up a chance to tie the game or take the lead, but Atlanta's C.J. Henderson made a diving interception of Jacoby Brissett's pass with 1:30 remaining to seal it.

Robinson had 92 yards receiving on seven catches, including a 13-yard touchdown, and added 76 yards rushing on 16 carries. The 23-year-old became the third player in franchise history to gain at least 2,000 yards from scrimmage in a season, joining Jamal Anderson (1998) and William Andrews (1981 and 1983).

Arizona (3-12) has lost seven straight and 12 of 13 since starting the season 2-0.

The Falcons pushed ahead 26-16 early in the fourth quarter when Cousins scored on a 1-yard run, which capped a 12-play, 66-yard drive. Arizona cut the deficit to 26-19 with 4:37 left on Chad Ryland's 34-yard field goal, taking advantage of Cousins' fumble at midfield.

Brissett completed 16 of 31 passes for 203 yards with a touchdown and an interception. The veteran has a 1-9 record as the Cardinals' starter since taking over for the injured Kyler Murray in Week 6.

Arizona tight end Elijah Higgins had 91 yards receiving on seven catches.

Atlanta rallied from an early 10-point deficit to tie the game at 16-all heading into halftime. Cousins hit Kyle Pitts for an 11-yard touchdown with 25 seconds left in the second quarter. Calais Campbell, Arizona's 39-year-old defensive end, blocked the extra-point attempt to keep the Falcons from taking the lead.

Arizona tried a 50-yard field goal to take the lead just before the break, but Ryland's kick was no good, bouncing off the right upright.

Ryland also missed a 44-yard attempt in the third quarter wide right.

The Cardinals took a 10-0 lead midway through the first quarter after Michael Wilson made a circus catch for a 32-yard touchdown. Falcons cornerback Cobee Bryant and Wilson tumbled into the end zone as they fought for possession and the ball bounced between them, eventually settling between Wilson's legs without hitting the ground.

Cardinals: CB Max Melton (heel), LT Paris Johnson Jr. (knee) and S Jalen Thompson (hamstring) were among six inactives. ... CB Garrett Williams (Achilles tendon) left in the first quarter and had to be carted off the field after the non-contact injury. ... Rookie DL Walter Nolen III (knee) was carted off in the third quarter. ... DL Josh Sweat (ankle) was hurt during the first quarter and initially returned, but was ruled out in the third quarter.

Falcons: Host the Los Angeles Rams on Monday, Dec. 29.

Cardinals: At Cincinnati next Sunday.

title: Jake LaRavia opens up about his shooting struggles
description: LaRavia hasn't been as efficient as the Lakers have hoped this season.
fullText:
Jake LaRavia opens up about his shooting struggles originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Los Angeles Lakers have struggled from three-point range this season, shooting 34.3%, 25th in the NBA.

In a 15-point loss last night against the Clippers, the Lakers shot an abysmal 16% from three (6-for-38). With Rui Hachimura and Deandre Ayton sidelined, Jake LaRavia entered the starting lineup.

Although the fourth-year forward posted a double-double with 12 points, 11 rebounds and six assists, he continues to struggle from beyond the arc.

LaRavia shot 0-for-4 from deep in what has been an inefficient shooting season. His 30.5% from deep is a career-low, after averaging a career-high 42.3% from beyond the arc last season.

Following the game, LaRavia spoke on his shooting struggles, expecting to get back on track soon. ¬†‚ÄúI know I‚Äôm a good shooter, everyone on the staff knows I‚Äôm a good shooter, everyone on the team knows I‚Äôm a good shooter,‚Äù LaRavia said. ‚ÄúAt some point, I have to make shots. Obviously, been in a slump pretty much this entire season outside of that first stretch of games where I was making some. But they‚Äôll drop.‚Äù

For Los Angeles, they'll need LaRavia to step up, especially if Luka Doncic is sidelined for an extended period. Even when Los Angeles is fully healthy, 34.3% from deep isn't a recipe for success in the modern NBA.

In addition to LaRavia, role players like Marcus Smart, Gabe Vincent and Dalton Knecht will be relied upon to knock down threes in support of Doncic, LeBron James and Austin Reaves.

The Lakers will return to action Tuesday against the Phoenix Suns.

description: Trae Young is quickly returning to his All-Star form after missing 21 games with a knee injury.  Now, the Atlanta Hawks can shift their focus to healing their ailing defense. fullText:
ATLANTA (AP) ‚Äî Trae Young is quickly returning to his All-Star form after missing 21 games with a knee injury.

Now, the Atlanta Hawks can shift their focus to healing their ailing defense.

The Hawks ranked 22nd in scoring defense before Sunday's 152-150 loss to the Chicago Bulls in the NBA's highest-scoring game this season.

The Bulls had nine scorers in double figures, led by Matas Buzelis with 28 points. The Bulls' 152 points set a season high. They also set season highs with 41 assists, 57.6% field goal percentage and 47.6% 3-point shooting (20 of 42).

Young scored a season-high 35 points with nine assists. Jalen Johnson had 36 points with 11 rebounds and nine assists.

The Hawks also had Onyeka Okongwu score 23 points and Vit Krejci add 20. Young's encouraging showing and all the offense wasn't enough to overcome the leaky defense. The Bulls set another season high by scoring 83 points in the first half.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs kind of tough winning games when you give up 80 points in the first half,‚Äù Johnson said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs kind of embarrassing in a sense. ‚Ä¶. Hopefully we cut down on some of the things we‚Äôre doing.‚Äù

The Hawks (15-15) have lost three straight and seven of nine to fall back to .500.

Young started for the second time in three games after missing 21 games with a right MCL sprain.

‚ÄúI think everybody is excited to have Trae back,‚Äù Johnson said. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs been out for a while. ... The fact he‚Äôs found his rhythm already in his second game is a good sign.‚Äù

Coach Quin Snyder said Young may need more time before he's ready to play back-to-back games.

Young logged 26 minutes against Chicago, which he said was his limit for his second game back.

‚ÄúI feel amazing,‚Äù Young said. ‚ÄúThey did their job, put me right at 26 minutes. They weren‚Äôt allowing me to do any more. ... I feel great.‚Äù

Young led the NBA in assists last season and is a four-time All-Star. He scored only eight points in 20 minutes in his first game back, a 133-126 loss at Charlotte on Thursday night. He was back in his high-scoring form against Chicago but missed a last-second jumper that would have tied the game.

‚ÄúThose are shots that he makes," Snyder said. ‚ÄúYou feel good about getting the ball in the right guy‚Äôs hands.‚Äù

Snyder said the Hawks ‚Äúhad a lot of breakdowns in execution‚Äù on defense in the first half. The Bulls scored 69 points in the second half and made 54.3% of their shots from the field, but Snyder said his defense ‚Äúdid a better job with that in the second half as far as making them work hard.‚Äù

Young said the high-scoring pace was no surprise.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs how both teams play,‚Äù Young said. "Both teams play fast. Teams are coming in here and playing fast against us. We‚Äôve got to figure out how to stop a team that can only play fast.'

AP NBA: https://apnews.com/hub/NBA

title: Cowboys' Trevon Diggs finally explains concussion; unsure of future with team
description: Trevon Diggs has come clean about how his October concussion. He also acknowledges that he is uncertain if he'll stay on with the Cowboys in 2026.
fullText:
After two months of rampant speculation and mysterious silence on the subject, Cowboys cornerback has finally given an explanation for how he got a concussion back in mid-October, an incident that kickstarted his latest string of eight missed games.

His version of events, however, may not do much to quiet the calls for Dallas to cut ties with him.

The two-time Pro Bowler himself acknowledged that Sunday's loss may have been his final game at AT&T Stadium in a Cowboys uniform.

In the days leading up to the 2025 home finale versus the Chargers, NFL insider Jane Slater reported that Diggs had shared with her how he got the concussion. She classified his explanation then as "far less nefarious than some of the rumors" that had been circulating online.

After Sunday's 34-17 loss to Los Angeles, Slater shared- with Diggs's permission- that Diggs says he took a hit to the head while trying to install a TV from his ceiling. The pole mount, he said, fell on his head.

"I was trying to be a handyman," he reportedly told her.

Per Slater, Diggs "didn't think it was a big deal and didn't need to be addressed but speculation on the internet went way too far."

Some of you wanted to know how Trevon Diggs got concussed. It was never that crazy but the lack of answers made it sound like it was. With his permission he shared and here‚Äôs the video of it.

He says a tv he was trying to install from the ceiling with the pole mount fell on his‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/3ooFFZFWDb

‚Äî Jane Slater (@SlaterNFL) December 21, 2025

Diggs reportedly came to the Cowboys facility on Oct. 16 exhibiting concussion symptoms. He was declared out for the team's Week 7 contest versus Washington. The team moved him to injured reserve after that game, but reported the cause as a knee issue. He sat out longer than the mandated three games and was only elevated to the active roster this past Saturday, the final day of his evaluation window.

Diggs and the Cowboys were at odds for some time over why he wasn't back in the lineup sooner. Diggs had been claiming that he was fully healthy and ready to return; owner Jerry Jones disputed that, based on what he had exhibited in practice. Head coach Brian Schottenheimer alluded to consistency issues that had more to do with Diggs's all-around behavior.

Now pressed into service for the final three games due in large part to DaRon Bland's move to injured reserve, Diggs is faced with the possibility of being irreparably on the outs with the team that gave him a $97 million contract just two years ago.

"Yeah, possibly," he told reporters after the loss Sunday. "If this is my last [home] game with the Cowboys, it's tough."

Diggs got the start on Sunday in place of Bland. And while he was in on six tackles on the day, he was also notably the closest defender on a 25-yard second-quarter touchdown throw to Ladd McConkey and was repeatedly targeted by Chargers quarterback Justin Herbert, who threw for 300 yards and two touchdowns and finished with a spectacular passer rating of 132.8.

Despite the rollercoaster of drama that has marked his difficult 2025 season, Diggs has said he wants to return to Dallas next year.

"After the season, I guess we'll figure it out."

Todd is on X at¬†@ToddBrock24f7. Also, follow¬†Cowboys Wire on Facebook¬†to join in on the conversation with fellow fans!

This article originally appeared on Cowboys Wire: Cowboys' Trevon Diggs explains concussion; unsure of future with team

title: No. 5 UConn men‚Äôs basketball takes down DePaul, 72-54
description: Despite a sloppy start, UConn men‚Äôs basketball moved to 2-0 in the Big East with a convincing road win over DePaul in Chicago. While the Huskies (12-1, 2-0 Big East) looked out of sorts in the first half without star guard Solo Ball, they snapped out of it just in time to cruise to a [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Despite a sloppy start, UConn men‚Äôs basketball moved to 2-0 in the Big East with a convincing road win over DePaul in Chicago. While the Huskies (12-1, 2-0 Big East) looked out of sorts in the first half without star guard Solo Ball, they snapped out of it just in time to cruise to a comfortable 72-54 win.

Ball was surprisingly listed as inactive, ruled out with a wrist injury suffered after a hard fall in the conference opener against Butler on Tuesday. With Ball out, Jaylin Stewart returned to the starting lineup.

The Huskies were entirely out of sorts early on, turning it over six times in the first eight minutes alone, leading to 12 DePaul points.

The home team led for most of the start of the first half, up by as much as eight with 10:54 to play after Layden Blocker capped off a 7-0 run with a layup to lead 15-7. But Silas Demary Jr. and Alex Karaban did everything in their power to keep things from getting too out of hand. Demary Jr. helped UConn punch back, scoring five-straight points as part of a 9-0 run to give the Huskies their first lead of the night.

UConn would take the lead for good off a nifty reverse layup from Jaylin Stewart with 6:17 left to play, and Karaban and Demary helped stretch the lead to as much as five in the first half, combining for a 5-0 run in the final minutes before a Blocker buzzer beater cut the halftime lead to three.

Karaban was a much-needed stabilizing force throughout the entire first 20 minutes, scoring 10 points on a perfect 6-6 shooting from the field. He scored five of UConn‚Äôs first seven points as the offense sputtered out of the gate, and stretched the floor effectively with two 3-pointers. Demary Jr. started out on pace for a shot at another triple-double with seven points, five assists, and six boards in just the first half alone.

Despite only really being able to lean on those two and coughing up the ball 13 times for 16 Blue Demons points, UConn managed to lead 33-30 at the break after arguably its worst half of the season.

The Huskies looked revitalized after halftime and came out hot, scoring four quick points to go up seven. With the offense back on track, UConn rattled off a 12-2 run capped off with a Braylon Mulins jumper to lead 52-36 with 11:53 to play. The Huskies‚Äô defense tightened the clamps on the Blue Demons in the second half, with DePaul scoring just eight points in the first 10 minutes of the final period.

With the defense humming and the offense back on track, UConn stretched the lead to as much as 17 after a putback from Tarris Reed Jr. made it 58-41 with just under eight minutes to play. The Blue Demons did make one last attempt to get back in it by cutting the lead to 10 with four minutes to play, but a Reed fadeaway jumper off the glass extended the lead back to 12.

On the next possession, Karaban walled up and altered a DePaul shot on the block, then found Mullins for a three on the next possession to put the game away for good. Mullins would hit one more three-pointer the next time down for the cherry on top and finished the night with eight points.

Karaban led all scorers with 21 points, and added six rebounds, two assists, and a block. Reed Jr. posted his second double-double of the season with 14 points and 11 boards, and added four assists and three blocks. Demary Jr., who appeared to be under the weather, flirted with a triple-double and finished with 14 points, seven assists, eight rebounds, two blocks, and a steal.

UConn now embarks on a 10-day break for the holidays, with the Huskies returning to action on New Year‚Äôs Eve with a road game against Xavier. Tip-off against the Musketeers is set for 5:00 p.m. ET, with the game set to be broadcast on NBC Sports and available to stream on Peacock.

title: Chiefs HC Andy Reid praises the effort from veteran players in Week 16
description: During his postgame press conference, Kansas City Chiefs head coach Andy Reid praised the effort from veteran players in Week 16 | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
Kansas City Chiefs head coach Andy Reid spoke with reporters during his postgame press conference, praising the commitment from veteran players in the Week 16 loss to the Tennessee Titans.

‚ÄúYeah, nobody likes losing in this business. My hat goes off for the guys that put together all these years. ‚Äú That‚Äôs part of it,‚Äù said Reid. ‚ÄúWe can learn from it, and we need to do that going forward.‚Äù Sometimes a good kick in the tail helps you there. Coaches and players.‚Äù

After only one catch for six receiving yards in Week 16, tight end Travis Kelce recorded his 12th consecutive season with 800 receiving yards, tying Pro Football Hall of Fame wide receiver Jerry Rice for first all-time. The catch extended his reception streak to 189 straight games, which is the fifth-longest reception streak regardless of position.

"I appreciate Chris (Jones), (Nick) Bolton, Trey (Smith), Creed (Humohrey), those are guys who could very easily have taken a day off,‚Äù said Reid, ‚ÄúI appreciate the effort they put in.‚Äù

Bolton up the middle for the third down sack! pic.twitter.com/YBi43YKLzX

‚Äî Kansas City Chiefs (@Chiefs) December 21, 2025

Bolton‚Äôs four solo tackles against the Titans moved him into sixth place for most solo tackles by a linebacker in Chiefs history, surpassing Marvcus Patton‚Äôs 348 and bringing his total to 352 solo tackles.

title: Baker Mayfield's game-ending INT sums up Buccaneers' freefall perfectly
description: Of course it had to happen like that.
fullText:
Baker Mayfield's game-ending INT sums up Buccaneers' freefall perfectly originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Tampa Bay Buccaneers' form in the second half of the season has been horrible, and the ending to the 23-20 loss to the Carolina Panthers perhaps perfectly encapsulates that.

With the Buccaneers at the Panthers' 42-yard line and just about in field goal range, facing a second-and-nine, the offense could have picked up a few yards and been in good shape.

But Baker Mayfield threw a game-ending interception. Mike Evans was the target, and when he got to the top of his route, he cut inside, Baker threw it outside, and the rest is history.

Head coach Todd Bowles stated it looked like a simple miscommunication.

Yeah, unfortunately it was," Mayfield said. "I was trying to find a lane to step through and make the throw to him, and he thought I was going to scramble, which, based on some of the scrambles earlier to that, you can't blame him. It's just honestly, just sucky situation."

More:Why Buccaneers fans might not like Todd Bowles' message after Panthers loss

For a team that has lost six of its last seven games, you would think no.

But this NFL season has been odd.

And as such, if the Buccaneers win their last two games, on the road against the Miami Dolphins and then the next installment of the Panthers rivalry at home, then Bowles' team would punch its ticket to the postseason.

But based on how the Bucs have played over the last month, there is nothing guaranteed in the final two weeks.

Mayfield and Evans being on the wrong page with the game on the line doesn't happen often, and in the biggest moment, they had their wires crossed.

fullText:
This article originally appeared on PGHHockeyNOW.

Sidney Crosby scored once in the first period and added an assist Sunday night in a game against the Montreal Canadiens at PPG Paints Arena to tie and then pass Mario Lemieux for the most career points in Penguins history with 1,724 ‚Äî by any measure, an amazing accomplishment in a season where it seems Crosby is reaching some sort of milestone or record nearly every week.

Against the Canadiens, Crosby was playing in his 35th game this season. The points gave him a team-leading 37. For his career, he has 646 goals, 1,078 assists.

title: Instant Reaction: Cardinals Suffer More Injuries in Ugly Loss
description: The Arizona Cardinals lost for the 12th time this season, falling by a score of 26-19 to the Atlanta Falcons in front of a thin home crowd at State Farm...
fullText:
The Arizona Cardinals lost for the 12th time this season, falling by a score of 26-19 to the Atlanta Falcons in front of a thin home crowd at State Farm Stadium. Arizona‚Äôs overall effort was a mixed bag, but injuries truly began to pile up as a brutal season continued trending in a dismal direction. With two games remaining (one against a Los Angeles Rams team desperate to win the division), there‚Äôs little hope to see another game in the win column this season.

Arizona did finally play a close game for the first time in multiple weeks. Although it did come down to the final drive, it was another game that felt ugly, disjointed and tough to watch. While injuries have been pointed to as a culprit of this particularly poor season, Sunday‚Äôs bout of maladies may carry impact into 2026.

The Cardinals‚Äô offense was able to run the ball better than most efforts this season. For what felt like the first time in many weeks, Arizona put up 100-plus yards on the ground. A combination of Michael Carter, Corey Kiner and Emari Demercado were finally able to find some running room, combining for 127 yards on 22 carries ‚Äî a rate of just over 5.7 yards per carry.

Unfortunately, the passing attack that has been quite lethal in terms of overall volume production was nearly silent. QB Jacoby Brissett struggled, managing to complete just 16 of his 31 passes for 203 yards and one score. There were some key drops, but Brissett‚Äôs accuracy felt erratic.

TE trey McBride was held to just 27 yards on four receptions, and the Cardinals‚Äô leading receiver was backup TE Elijah Higgins.

Defensively, Arizona managed two turnovers. Their defensive front was able to get pressure on an immobile Kirk Cousins. DL Darius Robinson had an excellent game with seven tackles, a TFL, a pass defended and a fumble recovery. CB Will Johnson locked up Falcons WR Drake London one-on-one. In some ways, it might have been considered a mild bounce-back performance ‚Äî if not for the fact that star RB Bijan Robinson collected 168 total yards and a touchdown.

It was the type of effort one can expect from a team that has now lost seven straight. While the final score was ultimately close, it never felt that the Cardinals ‚Äî after holding a 16-10 lead late in the first half ‚Äî had a chance to put together enough offense to stay ahead of Atlanta.

But the most brutal reality of Sunday‚Äôs game is a tough one to accept. In a game that meant nothing in terms of standings or the playoff picture, Arizona lost multiple high-level contributors to injury.

OLB Josh Sweat was helped off the field with an ankle injury. C Hjalte Froholdt suffered an elbow injury. Even the ironclad Budda Baker had to exit the game for a concussion evaluation, though he did eventually return.

But two of the Cardinals‚Äô biggest defensive contributors suffered more concerning injuries. CB Garrett Williams left the game after a non-contact incident, and was quickly ruled out with an achilles injury ‚Äî words that ring ominous to his availability next season. And DL Walter Nolen III, who had not struggled with injuries in his football career prior to 2025, left on the cart, visibly emotional with a knee injury.

It‚Äôs one thing to lose games. In fact, many would likely prefer to see the Cardinals‚Äô draft stock increase. But to watch some of the more promising players on this defense leave with injuries of the non-contact variety is, somehow, the only way to make this brutal season a worse experience for loyal Cardinals fans.

title: Broncos' 11-game winning streak halted in devastating fashion by upstart Jaguars
description: The Denver Broncos drop to 12-3 on the 2025 season.
fullText:
Broncos' 11-game winning streak halted in devastating fashion by upstart Jaguars originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Denver Broncos had not lost a game since September 21. That changed on Sunday, when the Jacksonville Jaguars strolled into Empower Field and handed them a 34-20 defeat.

The loss tightens things up on the AFC playoff race as the Broncos are now just one game ahead of the Los Angeles Chargers in the AFC West and could be tied with the New England Patriots for the No. 1 overall seed, depending on what happens in New England's Sunday night tilt with the Baltimore Ravens.

The story of this game was much more about what Jacksonville did right than what Denver did wrong. The Jags were efficient on offense, moving the ball well against Denver's vaunted defense and cashing in against the league's best red-zone defense.

Trevor Lawrence, coming off the best game of his career last week, had another gem on Sunday, completing 23 of 36 passes for 279 yards with three touchdowns. Parker Washington had 145 yards receiving on six catches, forcing several missed tackles throughout the contest.

The Broncos had their chances to respond to the big shots being delivered by the Jaguars, but two second-half turnovers by Bo Nix knocked the Broncos out.

The Jaguars continued their historically good play in the Mile High City and now have a winning record of 5-4 all-time there. With the win, Jacksonville improves to 11-4 on the season, still very much in the race for the No. 1 overall seed and home-field advantage in the playoffs.

READ:¬†4 2026 offensive NFL Draft targets who could wind up with Denver Broncos

The Broncos won't have much time to sit and sulk over this loss as they will be back on the field on Christmas night at Arrowhead Stadium against the sputtering Kansas City Chiefs.

title: Steelers insane upset win sends 49ers to playoffs on their day off
description: The San Francisco 49ers are heading back to the postseason thanks to Week 16 action.
fullText:
The San Francisco 49ers are heading back to the postseason despite not suiting up yet in Week 16.

To clinch a playoff spot the 49ers needed the Pittsburgh Steelers to beat the Detroit Lions at Ford Field on Sunday. The seven-point underdog Steelers did San Francisco a favor by upsetting the Lions 29-24 while the 49ers sat in Indianapolis awaiting their Monday night showdown with the Indianapolis Colts.

The 49ers clinched thanks to the NFL's tiebreaking procedures.

San Francisco's maximum losses is seven, and Detroit on Sunday suffered their seventh defeat. The Lions are the only other team in the NFC that can reach 10 wins. At worst the 49ers could finished tied with the Lions at 10-7.

Since they didn't play head-to-head this season, the tiebreaking procedure moves to best record in conference games. The Lions are 5-5 within the NFC while the 49ers are sitting at 8-2. With only two games left against NFC opponents, the 49ers have clinched a better conference record than Detroit.

Clinching a playoff spot doesn't mean the 49ers will be in cruise control the rest of the way, however. They can still earn the NFC's No. 1 seed and a first-round bye if they win their final three games against the Colts, Chicago Bears and Seattle Seahawks.

A win over the Colts will clinch a top-six seed for the 49ers since the Green Bay Packers fell to the Chicago Bears on Saturday and dropped to 9-6-1, meaning their maximum number of wins would be 10, and one shy of the 11 the 49ers would reach with a win Monday night.

The 49ers and Colts are slated to kick off at 5:15pm Pacific Time on Monday.

More 49ers: Kyle Shanahan blames 49ers WR for not reaching $500,000 incentive yet

This article originally appeared on Niners Wire: San Francisco 49ers clinch playoff spot after Steelers upset Lions

title: Lions playoff hopes nearly dead after crushing loss to Steelers, 29-24
description: Detroit Lions playoff odds dropped to 6% after an excruciating loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers in Week 16 at Ford Field. Here's what we learned.
fullText:
The Detroit Lions' 2025 NFL playoff hopes were just crushed.

Needing a victory to virtually keep their postseason hopes alive, the Lions came up short at Ford Field on Sunday, Dec. 21, against the Pittsburgh Steelers, losing the Week 16 game, 29-24.

The Lions will be eliminated if the Packers win either of their final two games against the Baltimore Ravens or Minnesota Vikings.

It was an ugly and uninspired performance, especially with the season on the line, despite a late comeback effort.

BIG STORY: Lions fan says DK Metcalf swung at him after he used star's full name

The Lions took a 10-3 lead on an impressive 20-yard touchdown catch from rookie Isaac TeSlaa with 1:55 left in the first half, but it was all down hill from there. The Steelers went 80 yards and scored on a miracle TD with two seconds left before the break when running back Kenneth Gainwell made an impressive catch through contact, fell down but wasn't touched by linebacker Alex Anzalone and ran into the end zone to tie the game.

The momentum carried into the third quarter. The Lions ran just three plays in the period, tied for the fewest in a quarter for any team this season, according to the CBS broadcast, and one of those plays was a safety when Goff took a sack in the end zone.

The Lions were dominated in nearly every facet, particularly in the second half, but the real difference was on the ground. The Steelers rushed for 230 yards and broke two 45-yard TD runs in the fourth quarter, while the Lions rushed for just 15 yards.

Outside of the massive playoff implications, one of the biggest stories of the day took place in the stands. Steelers star wide receiver DK Metcalf got into an altercation with a Lions fan who was leaning over the ledge to talk with him and Metcalf took a swing at him.

Metcalf was not ejected from the game as officials did not see the play and thus couldn't throw a flag, meaning he couldn't be thrown out.

‚ÄúThere was no flag on the field, so New York cannot weigh in with regard to a potential disqualification,‚Äù the NFL said in a statement.

Metcalf had a quiet day, finishing with four catches for just 42 yards.

Dave Birkett covers the Lions for the Detroit Free Press. Contact him at¬†dbirkett@freepress.com. Follow him on¬†Bluesky,¬†X¬†and¬†Instagram¬†at @davebirkett.

This article originally appeared on Detroit Free Press: Lions playoff hopes crushed by Steelers in terrible 29-24 loss

title: Chicago‚Äôs worst enemy helps the Bears officially clinch the playoffs
description: Today, he's not half bad in the eyes of Chicago.
fullText:
Chicago‚Äôs worst enemy helps the Bears officially clinch the playoffs originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

On Saturday night, the Chicago Bears and Green Bay Packers gave NFL fans one of the best games of the season.

The two bitter divisional rivals battled until the very end, and even that wasn't enough as the game eventually went into overtime.

Between recovering an onside kick, scoring the TD in regulation to go into OT, and the bomb Caleb Williams dropped to DJ Moore, the Bears proved why they're the most clutch team in NFL history.

More:¬†Are the Bears the most clutch team in NFL history? The numbers say yes.

This win, while helping them retain the division lead and giving them a 74% chance to win the division, did not officially clinch it for them.

Chicago can win out the rest of the way to secure the NFC North title and clinch a playoff birth, but instead, arguably the city's greatest enemy secured the playoffs for them.

For years and years, Aaron Rodgers led the Green Bay Packers to win after win against the Bears. He racked up so many wins that he felt comfortable claiming himself to be the 'owner' of the franchise.

Rodgers has since bounced around a bit and finds himself now with the Pittsburgh Steelers. On Sunday, he and the Steelers faced the Lions in Detroit with a chance to secure a playoff birth for Chicago by defeating the Motor City.

With Aaron Rodgers leading the Steelers to a victory in Detroit, the Bears now have clinched a playoff spot. https://t.co/3b7p6ZbMnf

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) December 22, 2025

The Chicago Bears are officially playoff-bound for the first time since 2020.

Even though, by and large, the sentiment around Rodgers is poor among Chicagoans, today, he's not a villain. Just a helpful hand looking out for his old friends, the Bears.

Are the Bears the most clutch team in NFL history? The numbers say yes.

title: My husband and I are splitting our estate between his child and my three children. Should they get equal shares?
description: ‚ÄúWe try to help all our kids when we can, yet push for self-sufficiency.‚Äù
